ygData.messageBody:
According to Tony B:
> thats not really true- i believe most people dont group with necros because
> they arent really aware of what they can do. with our dot spells we can

That's true of most classes. "Straight" classes, like Cleric (healing please)
Warrior/Paladin (me slash), Wizard (want a little boom?) are highly sought,
because they're, well, simple. They do ONE thing (a little more for Cleric),
and they do it good. Other classes require subtlety, and that's something
that a lot of players seem to lack :(

> actually do the most damage to a creature, although it isnt as impressive as
> a wizard hitting with one spell for 50 damage or whatever; but if i can cast
> three dot spells on a creature at the beginning of the fight, that is some
> tough damage. the problem is that its effects are mostly unseen, so people

It is also why the creature will quickly stop attacking anyone and jump on
you :)

(tough lesson, at early level 8. I was "icing" a Sand Scarab, as usual, but
the Monk I team with forgot at the beginning to click on its auto attack, and
was only using its special attacks. After the 2nd Shock of Ice, the Scarab
dropped all and ran straight to me... I had to fight it staff to claw, and
repeatedly attempt to go a spell thru... I managed it, but barely)

> dont give it credit. also, necros have some pretty versatile spells, such
> as dark empathy (healing), dark pact series (gives us more mana- good for
> extended fights), and such. we also get many spells that cannot be
> resisted.

Necros are combos casters. Nothing they do is impressive in it, but the
association is a LOT more impressive.
